Scotty_Emerick:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Scotty Emerick | image = Scotty Emerick.jpg | caption = Scotty Emerick at the Maverick Saloon in Santa Ynez, California. | birth_name = Walter Scott Emerick | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|7|11}} | origin = [[Hollywood, Florida]], United States | instruments = Guitar, vocals, Piano, Mandolin | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1993–present | label = [[Rising Tide Records|Rising Tide]],{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=2Q4EAAAAMBAJ&q=%22rising+tide+records%22&pg=PA10|title=Universal Closes Rising Tide|last=Flippo|first=Chet|date=March 21, 1998|access-date=September 21, 2010}} [[DreamWorks Nashville]], [[Show Dog Nashville]], [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]] | website = {{URL|www.scottyemerick.com/}} }} '''Walter Scott Emerick''' (born July 11, 1973, in [[Hollywood, Florida]]) is an American [[country music]] artist, known primarily for his work with [[Toby Keith]]. In addition to penning several of Keith's singles, Emerick has also written for [[Sawyer Brown]], [[George Strait]], [[Kenny Chesney]] and several other artists. In 2004, Emerick was named "Songwriter of the Year" by the Nashville Songwriters Association.{{cite web|title=Scotty Emerick/Biography|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/scotty-emerick-mn0000305142/biography|website=allmusic.com|publisher=Allmusic|access-date=January 21, 2017}} He recorded an album, ''The Coast Is Clear'', for [[DreamWorks Records]] in 2003, and has charted four singles on the country charts, including a No. 24-peaking duet with Keith, "I Can't Take You Anywhere", which Keith had previously recorded on his 2001 album ''[[Pull My Chain]]''. "What's Up with That", performed by Emerick, was featured in the soundtrack to the film ''[[Broken Bridges]]''.{{cite web | title=Broken Bridges – Original Soundtrack – Songs, Reviews, Credits | website=AllMusic | url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/broken-bridges-mw0000577470 | access-date=April 12, 2018}} ==Biography== Emerick is best known for his songwriting association with [[Toby Keith]]. Amongst his co-writing credits are the Number Ones "[[I'm Just Talkin' About Tonight]]," the [[Willie Nelson]] duet "[[Beer for My Horses]]," "[[I Love This Bar]]," "[[Whiskey Girl]]," and "[[As Good as I Once Was]]", as well as the Top Five hits "[[Get Drunk and Be Somebody]]" and "[[A Little Too Late (Toby Keith song)|A Little Too Late]]." Emerick plays acoustic guitar and sings backing vocals, and as of April 2018, he is credited on 23 Toby Keith releases.{{cite web | title=Scotty Emerick – Credits | website=AllMusic | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/scotty-emerick-mn0000305142/credits | access-date=April 12, 2018}} As a musician, Emerick began his songwriting career in the mid-1990s, landing cuts by [[Sawyer Brown]],{{cite web | last=Foster | first=Fran | title=Local Scotty Emerick is making his mark in the country music world | website=TCPalm | date=January 20, 2016 | url=http://www.tcpalm.com/specialty-publications/vero-beach/local-scotty-emerick-is-making-his-mark-in-the-country-music-world-293eb2f6-7a3c-0e5e-e053-0100007fc-365638691.html | access-date=April 12, 2018|archive-date=April 12, 2018 | archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20180412134318/http://archive.tcpalm.com/specialty-publications/vero-beach/local-scotty-emerick-is-making-his-mark-in-the-country-music-world-293eb2f6-7a3c-0e5e-e053-0100007fc-365638691.html}} including their Top 5 single "[[I Don't Believe in Goodbye]]", which he co-wrote with [[Bryan White]]. Emerick has also released four singles of his own, including the duet "I Can't Take You Anywhere", a collaboration with [[Toby Keith]] and a debut album, ''The Coast Is Clear'' (2003), for [[DreamWorks Records]] Nashville.{{cite web | title=The Coast Is Clear – Scotty Emerick – Songs, Reviews, Credits | website=AllMusic | url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/the-coast-is-clear-mw0001003994 | access-date=April 12, 2018 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130319034927/http://www.allmusic.com/album/the-coast-is-clear-mw0001003994 | archive-date=March 19, 2013 | url-status=dead }} After the closure of DreamWorks' recording division, he signed to Toby's label, [[Show Dog Nashville]]. Emerick was a frequent co-performer on Toby Keith's national stadium and arena tours as well as on the entertainer's [[USO]] tours to US military bases in Germany, [[Afghanistan]], and the [[Persian Gulf]].{{cite web | title=Toby Keith Visits Troops in Philippines, Guam and Hawaii on USO Tour – Pictures | website=Taste of Country | date=May 2, 2013 | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/toby-keith-uso-tour-2013-pictures/ | access-date=April 12, 2018| archive-date=April 12, 2018| archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20180412135646/http://tasteofcountry.com/toby-keith-uso-tour-2013-pictures/}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:14em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''The Coast Is Clear'' | * Release date: 2003 * Label: [[DreamWorks Records|DreamWorks]] |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:22em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
